100 errors means your missing a { and or a } we cant help you with this.

hes missing a ; not a { and or a }
[/quote]

if he was missing a ; it would say ; expected.[/quote]

client.java:17867: ‘;’ expected
public void savegame(boolean logout) {

proof right there =P

item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

server.java:293: ‘else’ without ‘if’
} else {
^
server.java:304: ‘catch’ without ‘try’
} catch (Exception e) {
^
server.java:304: ‘)’ expected
} catch (Exception e) {
^
server.java:304: not a statement
} catch (Exception e) {
^
server.java:304: ‘;’ expected
} catch (Exception e) {
^
server.java:271: ‘try’ without ‘catch’ or ‘finally’
try {
^
server.java:308: ‘catch’ without ‘try’
} catch (java.io.IOException ioe) {
^
server.java:308: ‘)’ expected
} catch (java.io.IOException ioe) {
^
server.java:308: not a statement
} catch (java.io.IOException ioe) {
^
server.java:308: ‘;’ expected
} catch (java.io.IOException ioe) {
^
server.java:265: ‘try’ without ‘catch’ or ‘finally’
try {
^
server.java:316: reached end of file while parsing
}
^
12 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

i got 12 errors after adding */ — i show where i added—

/*
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“delta”) && !connectedFrom.equals(“127.0.0.1”) && !connectedFrom.startsWith(“adsl-99”)){
println(“Not from localhost!”);
returnCode = 9;
disconnected = true;
savefile = false;
return;
}*/

}
